content.description: Harder moves in the beginning lead to fun, pumpy, and reachy climbing out this large roof. Sit start deep in the cave on slopey underclings. Traverse straight out the roof then take a slight right to gain the right facing crack/feature. Top out.
content.protection: Several pads. Sloped rock slab for landing.
content.location: Lies roughly in the center of the whole cave. Sit start is below a large gash in the roof.

content.description: One of a kind feature for the Black Hills discovered by Luke Kretschmar. This cave is technically a natural arch, extending for 50'+, 25' at it's widest, and at about 60 degrees. The ground parallels the wall so a fall is never far, but keeping pads in situ can be annoying. Currently only one problem has been established. Potential for a few harder ones. Stays dry except for the top outs. Entrance and the top outs face West.
